caption.p: MeV F heptad repeats at the C terminal domain (HRC)-derived peptide. Following its engagement with any MeV receptor, H triggers F which inserts its fusion peptide in the host membrane ( A). Then, F undergoes serial conformational changes to reach its post fusion state, bringing the two membranes close enough to form a fusion pore ( B). MeV F HRC-derived peptides interact with MeV F HRN and catch the intermediate states of MeV F to block the fusion, regardless of the insertion of the fusion peptide in the host membrane ( C, D).
